[https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristofer-potts-b9903044/ Kristofer Norman Viking Potts] (born February 24, 1976) is a Canadian entrepreneur, construction executive, and former commercial diver. He is the founder and chief executive officer of [https://norsemanconstruction.ca/ Norseman Construction & Development Ltd.], recognized for integrating technology-driven processes into traditional building. Potts is also the host of the YouTube series [https://www.youtube.com/@KrisPottsOfficial Construction Disruption][https://www.linkedin.com/in/kristofer-potts-b9903044/] (2025), which explores the industrialization of construction and emerging housing technologies.
Early Life and Education
Potts was born on February 24, 1976, in North York, Ontario, Canada, to Robert John Potts and Karin Moen Irene Potts. He grew up in Toronto’s Beaches neighborhood with his brother, Kevin Potts.
He attended Williamson Road Public School (1980–1988) and Montcrest School (1988–1990), where he participated in swimming, soccer, and running. He studied at Malvern Collegiate Institute, transferred to Birchmount Park Collegiate Institute and Eastern Commerce Collegiate Institute, then returned to Malvern from 1994 to 1997.
In June 1999, he graduated from S.O.L.E. (School of Life Experience) Alternative School, a Toronto District School Board program providing flexible secondary pathways.
In 2000, Potts enrolled at The Underwater Centre in the United Kingdom, completing training in scuba, surface-supplied, and surface-supplied top-up diving, earning his HSE commercial diver certificate.
Career
* Commercial Diving (2000–2004) - Potts worked as a commercial diver internationally after his training at The Underwater Centre. Assignments included:
* Andark Diving & Watersports — contracted work, including aircraft wreckage search operations in the English Channel (2001).
* Stealaway Diving (Oban, Scotland) — maintenance diving on fish farms.
* Abwood Marine — underwater works on the Hungerford (Golden Jubilee) Bridge assembly in the Thames River.
* BCD Marine / Algosaibi (Persian Gulf, 2002) — offshore diving in the Middle East.
* Norseman Construction (2005–present) - In 2005, Potts founded Norseman Construction & Development Ltd., which grew from a one-person operation to an award-winning, multi-million-dollar builder. Norseman is known for its transparent client process, innovative building methods, and technology adoption, including robotics, 3D concrete printing, and SIPs. The company has been profiled in the Toronto Star, National Post, and Toronto Sun for its approach to high-end renovations and new housing initiatives.
* Hospitality Ventures (2011–2017)- From 2011 to 2017, Potts co-owned and operated The Corner House Irish Pub on Gerrard Street East in Toronto with his wife Becky and their son William. The pub became a neighborhood fixture known for its Irish fare, community events, and entertainment.
Notable Projects
* Project LiveWell (Concept) — Potts leads this initiative for industrialized mid-rise housing using 3D printing, SIPs, and modular systems.
* LiveWell Training Program (2025–) — An eight-week tuition-free training program in 3DCP and SIPs, co-developed with Printerra and Build a Dream, supported through Ontario’s Skills Development Fund.
Innovations
* MaxiPrinter 3D Concrete Printer (2024–2025) — In 2024, Norseman Construction became the first Canadian company to acquire and operate the MaxiPrinter, a large-scale mobile 3D concrete printer designed for on-site additive manufacturing. The machine was delivered from Dubai to Toronto and publicly unveiled through Norseman’s official channels and company website.
* In partnership with Printerra and Build a Dream, Norseman also launched one of Canada’s first 3D concrete printing training programs, supporting Ontario’s Skills Development Fund and helping establish Additive Construction as a Service (ACaaS) in Canada.
Awards and Recognitions
* Consumer Choice Award (2019–2025) — GTA Home Renovation category, six consecutive years.
* RenoMark Award (2024) — Recognized for renovation excellence.
* HomeStars Best of Award (2022–2025) — Multiple-time winner.
* HomeStars Giving Back Award (2018, 2019) — Community contributions.
* Best of Houzz (2018, 2019) — Design & Customer Service.
Podcasts & Media
* Room to Improve Podcast (2019) — Co-hosted the Improve Canada–sponsored series featuring construction and legal experts.
* Khurram Qureshi Podcast (2025) — Appeared as guest on Episode 12 of the Khurram Qureshi Podcast, produced by DigiPix Inc., discussing 3D printing, Project LiveWell, workforce training, and Construction Disruption.
* Gurmeet Judge Podcast (2025) — Interviewed on the Gurmeet Judge Podcast, discussing leadership in construction innovation and training initiatives.【citation pending】
* Construction Disruption (2025) — Potts is host of Construction Disruption, a 26-episode YouTube series documenting emerging technologies in construction.
